intro: Draba verna var. praecox, commonly known as early spring sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–15 cm. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, blooming early in the spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Its leaves are basal, linear, and often covered in a fine layer of white wax.
